page.title: 15 Artificial Landscapes
page.content: In Howfield Wood the firm of Bretts is carrying out gravel extraction. Careful land management is taking place.Large areas of sheep pasture are under temporary use as gravel sites.First the topsoil is removed, stored and the gravel extracted. Lakes are formed.The pits are then backfilled and the topsoil replaced.It soon returns to sheep pasture. There is a man who owns 88 acres of woodland to the east of Dunkirk and has lived in a caravan in the middle of a 30 acre clearing in the woods for 15 years.He owns a haulage business.The lorries bring the waste rubble left over from motorway and roadway construction and repair work,and dump it in the clearing.It is then bulldozed flat.His site is beside the new A2.The timber cut in the clearing is sold for pulp.
